data.text: Most of all, Paddy was a thoroughly decent, compassionate, knowledgable & thoughtful human being. The UK, liberal democracy & rational, moderate, cross-party debate have lost a great advocate. My thoughts are with Paddy's family & friends. He will be sorely missed. 2/2

Desperately sad news about Paddy Ashdown. I’ve seldom known a public servant with so much energy & dynamism. A passionate & charismatic leader & brilliant communicator, never more so than when he championed the Balkans & appealed to govts of the day to do more in the 1990s. 1/2
I hope Conservative MPs will back the PM in the vote today.  We need no distractions from seeking the best outcome with our neighbours, friends and partners in the EU.

Delighted to give a reading last night at a magical candlelight carol service to raise money for @bloodwise_uk - the UK’s leading blood cancer research charity. Thanks to everyone who took part and gave so generously. https://t.co/zhm41w4o5l

Absolutely delighted the UK has achieved my pledge of sequencing 100,000 whole genomes. We are leading the world in genomics – and changing the lives of those with rare diseases and cancer. Thank you to everyone involved @GenomicsEngland #Genomes100K https://t.co/oVuJaFcbUw

Five years after UK launched @WorldDementia Council at the G8, we've made huge strides. There is light at the end of a very long tunnel - and early diagnosis, big data, tech and funding are key. My speech to World Dementia Council today: https://t.co/T45r8dE5N7

So sad to hear that George HW Bush has passed away. He was a very good man, a great President & a warm hearted, generous American patriot who was a strong ally & friend of the UK. Receiving “Bush 41” & his wonderful wife Barbara at No10 was a huge honour that I will never forget.

So very sad to hear that Baroness Trumpington has passed away. She was one of a kind - they simply don’t make politicians like that anymore. She will be sorely missed in Westminster but long remembered for her outstanding ability and great humour. RIP Trumpers. https://t.co/4VNU9kJKCw

Delighted to speak at two fantastic causes close to my heart this week: @NCS, the UK’s flagship youth development programme; and @ARUKnews, helping their fundraising for vital research into the cause and prevention of dementia. Two great causes - do please get involved!
Wishing HRH The Prince of Wales a very Happy 70th Birthday today!  #Charlesat70 @ClarenceHouse https://t.co/Xjap7qKhd7
At the going down of the sun and in the morning, we will remember them #Armistice100

As we commemorate #Armistice100, we also remember our brave service personnel who are left with deep scars. I’ve been privileged over the years to visit Headley Court to see their inspiring work & am delighted to continue supporting @dmrc_benfund #HelpingThoseWhoServeTheirCountry https://t.co/IeukW6bXyS

Desperately sad news about Sir Jeremy Heywood. He was an amazing man, brilliant civil servant and dedicated to our country.  It was a privilege to work with him. All our thoughts and love are with Suzanne and the children.

Our oceans are in crisis. The UK led the world in protecting vast areas from plastics & overfishing by establishing a "Blue Belt”. Today @JohnKerry & I announce our co-chairmanship of @pewenvironment @Bertarelli_fdn #OceanAmbassadors to help save our seas https://t.co/Y1knZ67VxB
So happy for @RuthDavidsonMSP and Jen. Wonderful news that they have welcomed a baby boy – lucky Finn to have such great parents!
Sir Jeremy Heywood is the outstanding civil servant of his generation. Sam and I wish him well with his retirement, treatment and recovery. https://t.co/F1Dy9vNYlK
A powerful reminder of why #PovertyisSexist from @ONECampaign this #DayoftheGirl https://t.co/bpkKXzxuxM

Fascinating visit to @illumina Foster City campus in San Francisco recently: home of the Illumina Accelerator programme that is helping entrepreneurs turn innovative new ideas into successful businesses that use genomics to improve - and save - lives https://t.co/r7zdM77uG4
Great to see @MohamedNasheed. We first met over a decade ago. UK has always stood up for democracy and against corruption in the Maldives. https://t.co/prd5lRrkyZ
RT @ARUKnews: Barbara Windsor’s husband Scott Mitchell opens up to @TheSun in a moving interview about their life with Alzheimer's and why…

Proud to have set up the 100,000 Genomes Project which gave Britain a lead in this vital technology that can help us crack cancer and rare diseases. Congratulations to @MattHancock for putting rocket boosters under it, now aiming to sequence one million whole genomes. Great news. https://t.co/UssyDmf4kf

Many congratulations to @ShaunBaileyUK, selected today as the @Conservatives’ candidate for London Mayor. I’ve known Shaun for many years. He’s a great campaigner, a passionate advocate for our capital city & will provide a strong voice for Londoners. I wish him well! #BackBailey https://t.co/ViV9daMeOQ

Medical research has already made amazing progress in diseases like cancer and HIV/AIDS. With your support, we can do the same with diseases like Alzheimer’s that cause dementia. RT @ARUKnews’ new film and help #MakeBreakthroughsPossible this #WorldAlzheimersDay https://t.co/rSVfPcJDCz

Great meeting with the British Chambers of Commerce in Shanghai. Particularly good to meet such a wide range of British companies flying the flag for the UK in China and to learn more about the challenges and many opportunities of doing business in China. https://t.co/cGjTcQG16d

Hard to find a better, more intellectually robust argument in favour of aid and private sector development than this article by Paul Collier. 

https://t.co/9m4g60YFhS
The USA has lost a brave, principled and inspiring leader. The world has lost a great defender of liberty. RIP Senator John McCain. Prayers and love to your family. https://t.co/cFyPaRNmgR

So very sad to hear the news that Sir Peter Tapsell has passed away. He was a great Parliamentarian in the very truest sense & it was a privilege to have served alongside him in the House of Commons. My thoughts are with his family & friends. https://t.co/MNPfi0gqxh
My thoughts are with all those hurt in this morning’s incident in Westminster, and profound thanks to the emergency services who responded so quickly and bravely.

Great to spend time last week with this brilliant group of young people beginning their @NCS journey. Anyone who has seen NCS up close knows what a powerful investment it is in the future of our country. https://t.co/0zlkjVVCZa
Big congrats to @chrisfroome too, taking 3rd place and joining G on the podium. British cycling at its best once again. Well done to everyone involved! #TDF2018

Huge congratulations to @GeraintThomas86 on a phenomenal performance to win the #TDF2018. Words cannot adequately express what an epic achievement this is - Wales & the whole of the UK is proud of you G & will be cheering you on down the Champs-Élysées this afternoon! https://t.co/pALsDyMLBv
RT @VotePursglove: Fitting start as @Conservatives Vice Chairman for Youth to meet with brilliant @NCS young people in #CorbyEN earlier. Gr…

Serving as PM brought many privileges, but none more so than meeting great British heroes like Sqn Ldr Geoffrey Wellum DFC, who sadly passed away this week. As the youngest Spitfire pilot in the Battle of Britain, he was one of “The Few”. We will remember them. RIP Geoffrey. https://t.co/lnRX4oh4mb
Brilliant to see this further investment in Alzheimer’s research. Thank you @BillGates! https://t.co/SRd31NykFx
Delighted that @wigdortz will be the new Chair of @NCSTrust. Have no doubt that he will have every success in taking @NCS on to the next stage in its history.
Well done @England on the fantastic achievement of reaching the #WorldCup semi-finals. It wasn’t to be this time, but you played like lions and made us all so proud. 🦁🦁🦁#ThreeLions

Peter Carrington was a lovely man and a great public servant. It was a huge honour having him to Chequers and listening to his stories of working with every Conservative leader from Winston Churchill onwards. Kindness and brilliance in equal measure; he'll be deeply missed. https://t.co/nPxTobnP8Z
What an incredible result - well done @England; huge congratulations! Bring on the Semis for #ThreeLions... We’re all proud and cheering you on!

Last night I enjoyed a real father and son moment: first, calmly explaining that England and penalty shootouts don't go together, and then the sheer joy, delight and exhilaration at an @England victory! Well done #ThreeLions Onwards...!

Yesterday a British hero passed away. Patrick Churchill from Witney was one of the brave men who stormed the beaches on D-Day. It was a privilege to take him back 70 years later. We must never forget what they did for us all. https://t.co/sLNQ2vDjWR

Powerful piece by @aliceTTimes and @RSylvesterTimes quite rightly commending the work of the Mulberry Bush School near Witney that has turned around so many troubled children's lives @MulberryBushOrg https://t.co/FH5cKleAEw

As this powerful film with @simonpegg shows, Alzheimer's is not an inevitable part of ageing. With research, we can find a way through to beat the diseases that cause it. So please join me in supporting @ARUKnews & share this film. #DementiaUncovered https://t.co/e9KisqTT0Q
Well done @England - fantastic start! Wishing you the best of luck for this #WorldCup. Come on #ThreeLions

Pleasure to meet with @anwaribrahim in London to discuss recent Malaysian elections, his extraordinary story of courage and fortitude, and his strong desire to reform Malaysia’s economy and institutions. https://t.co/h5hD98NHrK

Delighted to help launch Coalition for Global Prosperity. I'm proud of our 0.7% development spending promise. It's not just morally right - it's in the interest of our national security & position in the world too. @BritainLeads - passionate about making the case: #UKAid works. https://t.co/U19TmFQDqB
RT @10DowningStreet: The Government has invested £50m to make hospitals and care homes dementia friendly, doubled funding for dementia rese…
Huge congratulations to Prince Harry and Meghan Markle, the Duke and Duchess of Sussex #RoyalWedding

Great to visit @GoldmanSachs - match funders of the @FT Seasonal Appeal in support of Alzheimer's Research UK @ARUKnews. Excellent discussion about how, with research and funding, we really can win the fight against dementia. https://t.co/8tv3fCblTz

Devastated that Tessa Jowell has passed away after her incredibly brave fight. I had the pleasure to work with her on the London 2012 Olympics - she was not just a dedicated & passionate campaigner, but a wonderful human being. My heartfelt condolences to her family & friends. https://t.co/ih96nl7YuS

Good visit to Mexico City this week, reflecting on strong relations that have been established between Mexico & UK over recent years. Interesting discussions with business leaders & civil society orgs ahead of July elections & great to catch-up with my friend President @EPN https://t.co/CwTVr1rrBs

It's Polling Day. Make sure you have your say on the things that impact your day to day life - things like bin collections & roads. Vote Conservative today for lower taxes & better services 🗳 https://t.co/sFuroqt72E
Michael Martin was Speaker when I was elected Leader of the Opposition in 2005 and showed me many kindnesses. He was a good man, who loved the House of Commons. My thoughts are with his family.
Powerful @BBCNews video on how @NCS is building social cohesion in Rotherham. “We are bonding over our differences. People think difference tears things apart but it doesn't.” https://t.co/wc4GR6UeNn
Many congratulations to The Duke and Duchess of Cambridge on the birth of their baby boy. Enjoy this precious time!
Very happy birthday to Her Majesty The Queen! There can be no finer public servant - have a wonderful day Ma’am. #QueensBirthday #HappyBirthdayHerMajesty https://t.co/TNbwwBZKhn
Great piece by my #FragilityCommission co-chair @DonaldKaberuka. Learnt a lot from his work and insights https://t.co/gbK2O5zot0
Great response to launch of #FragilityCommission report at @CGDev and @USIP today. Here’s what it’s all about: https://t.co/0RbPVOKPfV

Delighted to launch the LSE-Oxford #FragilityCommission report in Washington DC today - with recommendations that amount to a new approach to state fragility & international aid. Read the full report here:  https://t.co/pe2TVOGnpr

Fragile countries recovering from conflict need power sharing agreements & checks & balances on the exercise of power before multi-party elections take place. That’s the best way to support successful democracies for the long term. Read more in @FT. https://t.co/8eLn2axejI
As the #FragilityCommission I chair prepares to publish its report today, I write in @guardian about helping countries out of the fragility trap. https://t.co/yBz6RO7i10 @The_IGC
Pleasure to talk to @camanpour about #FragilityCommission report being launched this week. https://t.co/MjxVEycJaK

Fascinating discussion with @CWEICofficial this morning as part of #CBF2018 where we considered #FragilityCommission report & what role the private sector can play in encouraging growth in fragile states. Particularly good to hear from @PaulKagame about Rwanda’s success. @The_IGC https://t.co/ghUtXA2vmg

As @Commonwealth18 comes to London, great to talk at @ChathamHouse about where we go next in the fight against #corruption. Ownership registers, sharing tax info, returning stolen assets. Huge agenda to push. 
@ONECampaign @TransparencyUK https://t.co/14tBBIKlE9
My thoughts are with our brave servicemen & women who have been called to duty. Let the message go out loud & clear: the use of chemical weapons is never acceptable. 2/2

I firmly support the military action taken in Syria. The barbaric & intolerable use of chemical weapons should never go unchecked. As we have seen in the past, inaction has its consequences - so PM right to join forces with our allies to take targeted & appropriate action. 1/2

People wrongly believe that dementia is an inevitable part of ageing. But it’s caused by physical diseases that, through research, we can fight. Please watch and share this short film about an orange from Alzheimer’s Research UK @ARUKnews and @BryanCranston #ShareTheOrange https://t.co/Ka5vIM8amd

Pleasure speaking today at Woodford County High School about why they should say yes to @NCS this summer - learn new skills, make new friends, give back to your community and, above all, have fun! https://t.co/h3W6VWSv0M
Another record-breaking year for Alzheimer's Research UK as researchers come to London from across the globe for the biggest #ARUKconf yet https://t.co/ke4AUsLw2D

Just given evidence to the US Senate Foreign Relations Committee on the emerging thinking of the #FragilityCommission and why aid needs to change if we are to deal with state fragility, tackle poverty and achieve the #SDGs

I first met Jo in Sudan where she was helping those suffering the ravages of war. She was devoted to helping others throughout her career and, through @DFID_UK’s Jo Cox Memorial Grants, that legacy will continue. A fitting tribute to a great humanitarian

Congratulations to the winners of this year’s @brain_prize, the global award recognising those who are leading the way in Alzheimer’s research. Proud that three out of the four winning researchers work in the UK and are supported by Alzheimer’s Research UK @ARUKnews https://t.co/Oia8PcjYrK
It was the right thing to do https://t.co/d4g2fFma23
A huge privilege to open St Piers School today, run by the brilliant @youngepilepsy https://t.co/8XlBXLy1zs

On world @rarediseaseday, what I learnt from our son’s rare disease & how genetic testing, like that carried out by @illumina, is making a transformational change in healthcare, ending the anguish & uncertainty #ShowYourRare https://t.co/0f1V02UHnz

Huge congratulations to @Tickets4Troops who have reached the milestone of donating one million tickets to our brave servicemen and women. Proud to have launched this brilliant charity that gives back this small token of thanks to those who give so much
Always loved this Matt cartoon from when I left my daughter in the pub near Chequers #30YearsOfMatt https://t.co/vQQmlyRHsZ

We’re halfway there. The 100,000 Genomes Project I helped set up in 2013 has hit the 50,000 mark. More research means faster diagnosis and better treatment of people suffering from rare diseases and cancer. Well done, everyone - let’s keep going https://t.co/5rImdXjY8S
Pleased to see this new independent report out today has found @NCS helps foster greater understanding and integration between young people from different backgrounds https://t.co/bN11Z99zqx

Great to meet @PaulKagame, @SenBobCorker, UN’s Liu Zhenmin & Richard Curtis at #WEF18 today to discuss LSE-Oxford Commission on how we help fragile states & refresh arguments for 0.7%. Our report on new approaches to this important developmental challenge launches later this year
Excellent meeting & enjoyable dinner with President Xi Jinping in Beijing, to talk about the ‘Golden Era’ in UK-China relations & plans for the new UK-China Fund. https://t.co/tnFpx1DNPp
Wishing everyone a very happy Christmas https://t.co/MRuTP5csTa
Incredibly proud of @NCS and the nearly 400,000 young people who have taken part. The UK’s fastest growing youth movement in a century. https://t.co/CTwSv17sNc

Speaking tonight at @TransparencyUK #TILecture17 - Britain was first G20 country to set up open register of beneficial ownership. We must keep promoting transparency and fighting the battle against corruption. https://t.co/2mzqcDaaaC
Thank you @Andrew_Adonis - your support means a huge amount. And well done everyone, the Royal Charter is another great moment in the story of @NCS. https://t.co/YugeuVVt0J

Nearly 100m children vaccinated thanks to UK aid 2011-16. That’s nearly 1.5m lives saved; lives that would've been lost to avoidable diseases. So I’m proud to join @ONECampaign Board to cont this work alongside the #FragilityCommission. We CAN defeat disease, poverty & corruption
Good report on the effectiveness of aid - and another reason UK should be proud of 0.7 per cent. Others promised, we did it. https://t.co/fh7n96WKJe

Dementia is not an inevitable part of ageing & we can crack it. This year’s @FT Seasonal Appeal is for Alzheimer’s research. I spoke to them this week on why research is so important & how @ARUKnews is leading the global fight against dementia https://t.co/bt5Bzz825u
Congratulations to Prince Harry and Meghan Markle. Wonderful news and I wish them a long and happy life together.

Blown away by the ambition and potential of @theforetrust at their launch tonight. 
Linking business expertise to charities can be a game changer for Big Society https://t.co/vXJRBvHPEd
A wonderful partnership for 70 years. Wishing The Queen and The Duke of Edinburgh a happy platinum wedding anniversary. https://t.co/Dnq44oUAk2
I’m incredibly proud of legalising Same Sex Marriage in the UK & delighted that other countries are looking to do the same. G’day Australia! https://t.co/Beg9poCc1T

As President of Alzheimer’s Research UK, it is fantastic to have the support and extraordinary backing of @BillGates in the fight against dementia. I️ very much look forward to working with him. https://t.co/3Tk2HvycR9
An honour to stand at The Cenotaph. And this blog by an old friend puts it better than I ever could. https://t.co/8pB7IuIAAj

NCS changes lives, builds confidence - and gives young people great experiences they will never forget. Brilliant that schools have this new guidance to help even more young people benefit https://t.co/GCPl2GBHJ7
Dementia is now biggest killer in the UK. Proud to be working with @ARUKnews to fight back - dementia is not inevitable & we can defeat it https://t.co/ZTJuIbUt9U
Great to be with @leehsienloong in Singapore. Discussed how to help fragile states, promote free schools and ASEAN trade https://t.co/nA2a38Rr2O
My thoughts are with New York today as, once again, a city that represents freedom and tolerance is struck by hatred and division
Delighted to see @RwandaCricket ground officially open after cricketing heroes match today. A proud legacy for my friend, Christopher Shale https://t.co/PqGS5IvpuH
Roosevelt saved US capitalism by reforming it. Strong argument by @NickBoles that UK Conservatives need to do same https://t.co/rkVHdMfTkh
RT @tracey_crouch: Great visit to @NCS at the Harris Academy in Beckenham #NCS #ncsselfie https://t.co/EoJmGzEeyk
Great design. Right location. Proud to have played a part to help make this happen. We must teach future generations what happened. https://t.co/1I74CrfIsV
And her cracking memoir reads like she is telling you one long & brilliant story. I wish her well. 3/3
She's brought so much to public life over the years; her contribution, warmth & devastating wit will be missed hugely 2/3
Jean Trumpington has retired from the HoL. An amazing women with an incredible story - they just don't make 'em like that any more 1/3 https://t.co/2SpIo78WbE
Just over a week to go until the start of autumn @NCS. There’s still time to sign up https://t.co/S8mgb0xOtP
Great meeting with @ARUKnews yesterday in Boston, discussing how we tackle the challenges around diagnosing dementia earlier https://t.co/Ko1n3DMkl8
Heartbreaking news about Anthony Gordon Lennox. He was one of the most decent people I ever met. Tragic he’s been taken from us so early. https://t.co/ic8CfybjpR
Just touched down in US to hear truly chilling news from Vegas. Heartfelt thoughts & prayers with all affected by senseless & sickening act
Delighted to see the continued success of this great Conservative reform https://t.co/Z5qRTvSeaR
Good two days in session with LSE-Oxford #FragilityCommission looking into what works and what doesn’t in helping fragile states https://t.co/6MV81j1THF
Positive meeting with Vice-Premier Ma Kai where we discussed economic partnership & potential for a future UK-China Fund for businesses. 2/2 https://t.co/fdPknjI2DU
Fascinating visit to Beijing to reinforce UK’s close relationship with China & the ‘golden era’ - something I'm very proud of. 1/2 https://t.co/lyDFGhUIQQ
A cause that is close to our hearts. @NoahsArkHospice will be a special place for children with life limiting conditions & their families https://t.co/UrXAfh8499
Dementia isn't an inevitable part of ageing, research can defeat it.  #ShareTheOrange to help fight misunderstanding on #WorldAlzheimersDay https://t.co/ng91d4yAQf
Ukraine has suffered from invasion and corruption. The young people I met @yes_ukraine are determined to give it a better future. Inspiring https://t.co/PdYyiF3MPG
My thoughts with all those affected by the appalling terrorist incident at Parsons Green. Thank you to emergency services for swift response
Meeting @NCS grads in Warrington yesterday made me proud of the huge difference this programme is making to young lives https://t.co/eSzcQt3A6V
My message to @CST_UK Manchester dinner yesterday: no opt-outs from defeating extremism - not for schools, unis, govts, communities, anyone https://t.co/4rqXh9SMj0
For @chrisfroome to win TWO Grand Tours in one year is a truly exceptional feat. My legs hurt after just peddling to work. Huge congrats! 🚴🥇
So proud to call West Oxfordshire home. @Charlbury Community Centre, which opened its doors yesterday, is another reason why https://t.co/uDlEt0Qzcl
Fantastic to watch @jimmy9 reach the magic 500 Test wicket milestone today. What an achievement. Proud moment for English cricket too 🏏
Great stuff from @ncsni grads, showing Prince Harry what @NCS is all about: meeting and volunteering with people from different communities. https://t.co/tegfDN1fuF
Well done @MattWarman & #NCSSkegness! It's great to see MPs getting stuck in & supporting @NCS in constituencies across the country. https://t.co/wgF0MgWNco
Worrying scenes in Barcelona. My thoughts are with everyone affected and emergency services assisting. https://t.co/VxdiLg5clZ
Great to see PM visiting brilliant @NCS project, where young grads are learning more about mental health to live happier & healthier lives. https://t.co/7qZgOu5par
Great to see @HMSQnlz come home to Portsmouth today - a hugely proud moment for our @RoyalNavy and our country. Congrats to all involved. 🇬🇧 https://t.co/iJOOO2qXWj
Proud that @NCS grads are involved in #Passchendaele100 commemorations - vital for young people; lest we forget. https://t.co/JVtcgSL0X7
It's 50 years since the Sexual Offences Act. I write in @PinkNews on the anniversary & why progress is still needed. https://t.co/7IaWbh9mhL
Massive congrats to Women's @englandcricket Team on winning #WWC17! What an amazing afternoon for British sport! 🏆🥇🏆 https://t.co/EDaUtCPkqT
Huge congats to @chrisfroome & @TeamSky! Phenomenal achievement to win @LeTour for 4th time! Epic ride; the whole country is proud. #F4OOMEY
Delighted that @BearGrylls has joined @NCS Patrons & with new partnership with @UKScouting - really exciting for teens wanting an adventure! https://t.co/1fUf4D0dN3
Building confidence, encouraging teamwork, developing resilience - @NCS has a profound impact on teens taking part: https://t.co/FKm9G7ELPB
Great to see so many researchers coming together in London as part of the global fight to defeat dementia. Research is the key. #AAIC17 https://t.co/FFsvz4J5LO
Really +ve & uplifing first meeting of @NCS Patrons yesterday - listening & learning from grads & meeting inspirational teens taking part. https://t.co/ztE7JY39Sc
By bringing young people together @NCS can change lives & our country too. Here’s why it's needed more than ever: https://t.co/4GCiJP2svx
Honoured to receive award from @UKPatchwork this week & to continue supporting their work inspiring young people to #GetInvolved in politics https://t.co/V2NPCmdYHz
Really enjoyed meeting an inspirational group of @UKPatchwork graduates yesterday, all committed to public service & wanting to #GetInvolved https://t.co/7mE4TUfYso
Remembering Chris Martin: my former Principal Private Secretary; my ‘Bernard’. #SAW2017 https://t.co/7lGg1XKh7a
Enlightening report on #Genomics by @CMO_England. I’m proud to have started the #genomes100k project & firmly believe this is the future. https://t.co/fuXqAy0VAS
Delighted to meet new Korean president @moonriver365 to discuss UK trade which has doubled in recent yrs & the worrying situation in N Korea https://t.co/moqxUpO6kh
Wishing u a v Happy Birthday Ollie! You have so many willing u on, now incl a not so cool fmr PM 🙈. Stay strong, work hard & have a fab day! https://t.co/4DVjgHoNzk
Task facing PM, given the circs, is to deliver the most stable govt possible - today's DUP deal helps achieve that. All Cons should support.
Great honour to receive Special Recognition Award at @TheIndianAwards. I'm proud of all I have done to strengthen the UK-India relationship. https://t.co/Ls7ojohMqz
Great to meet so many UK delegates at #BIO2017 - showing the world that the UK has one of the strongest life sciences sectors. #UKatBIO 🇬🇧 https://t.co/39KIvtMA6k
Appalling terrorist attack against Muslims worshipping peacefully in Finsbury Park. We must all stand together against such evil.
My heart goes out to all those affected. If you are please able to help, here are some details: https://t.co/SaNQKAMOEx
Truly horrific pictures of terrible fire in my local neighbourhood. My thoughts & prayers with everyone involved & brave emergency services.
This morning I voted for the @Conservatives – do remember to vote today!  #VoteConservative  #GE2017 https://t.co/QKEZjAu4HS
Proud to support @robertcourts today – working hard & providing a strong voice in my former seat of Witney & West Oxon.  #VoteConservative https://t.co/Ul7jm9zf7G
Such very sad news today that my friend, Ed Victor, has passed away. My thoughts are with Carol & Ed’s family. He will be missed by so many. https://t.co/KBHpEO1S0N
Very best of luck to all @Conservatives candidates today – I remember how nerve-wracking election days can be!  #VoteConservative #GE2017 https://t.co/j3ZzLEX3xR
I urge everyone to back @Theresa_May and the @Conservatives in tomorrow’s crucial election. #VoteConservative #GE2017 https://t.co/Z0C1qfr8Qx
This week’s election is crucial for the future prosperity of our country - #VoteConservative #GE2017 https://t.co/dBh573W2LF
The sun came out for campaigning today with the terrific @Lindsey4WNorth & local @Conservatives in Westminster N! #VoteConservative #GE2017 https://t.co/rk9pvVrFbm
We will not be cowed by terror. We should vote Thurs because our people & democracy are strong. We will show that terror can never win. 3/3
Our brave emergency services did - and do - an heroic job; I cannot praise them enough. 2/3
My heart goes out to all those caught up in last night's terror incident & my thoughts & prayers to the family & friends of those killed 1/3
Very best of luck & support to @theresa_may & all @Conservatives as we enter the final days before this crucial election! #VoteConservative
Deeply regret US pulling out of Paris accord. No agreement is perfect, but unlike previous deals all key countries involved. Backwards step.
Great to catch up with my good friend @BarackObama today. https://t.co/9LnMnTdlfQ
Brilliant #Hockney exhibition finishes Monday evening. Set to break records at @Tate Britain. Don't miss it! https://t.co/Qv0siBzKPe
I praise and thank our brave emergency services and thoughtful, caring, resolute Manchester community. #standtogether (2/2)
My heartfelt thoughts and prayers are with all the victims of last night's horrendous attack in Manchester and their loved ones. (1/2)
.@EndaKennyTD was a strong leader for Ireland, a great partner for the UK, and remains a good friend.
Great to see @stephenharper - another (not so old!) former Conservative PM, and a good friend and close ally of the UK. https://t.co/LY4wT3xnxF

(2/4) We are an open, tolerant and free nation. But we cannot stand by and allow our openness to be confused with a tolerance of extremism.
(1/4) As I made clear in my Commons statement, my first priority as PM is to make sure we do everything possible to keep our people safe.

data.text: I've just chaired a COBRA on the floods. I welcomed the Marines going to Somerset. All Govt depts doing all they can to help those affected.
With @GaryLineker at St Brigid's in Birmingham  announcing extra £750m for competitive school sports through to 2020. http://t.co/VuQj5NwJaq
RT @GaryLineker: Whatever your politics, investment in Sport in primary schools is worth supporting. Vital for our youngsters future in all…
From skiing to skating, bobsleigh to curling, let's support our athletes as they battle to bring medals home from Sochi. Come on @TeamGB!
.@beautyofblack An additional  £750million for primary school sport between now & 2020 Olympics, helping secure the legacy of London 2012.
Giving children a chance to enjoy and learn from competitive sport is massively important, that's why I've secured funding until 2020.
Great news for @bombardier and Derby with the £1billion Crossrail deal. Our #LongTermEconomicPlan means more jobs, security and opportunity.
I've just chaired COBRA on the latest storms and floods - I said there should be no restrictions on help for those affected,
Improving maths is crucial for our #LongTermEconomicPlan. Here's how we're making it happen with new incentives http://t.co/gG6HpP56WL
I'll be chairing a COBRA today to ensure all that can be done is being done over the latest storms, flooding and power cuts.
It was important to get to the truth of what happened at #Amritsar. Today's report is transparent about the level of British involvement.
Bob Crow's Tube strike is shameful, bringing misery to millions of Londoners. Ed Miliband should condemn it now: no 'ifs' and no 'buts'.
Calls to flooding helplines shouldn't be premium rate - I'm pleased the EA has introduced a cheaper UK-wide number: 0345 988 1188
I have ordered a rethink on pub opening times for England's World Cup games - will consult with pub trade, police and councils.
RT @Conservatives: Today 122 Labour & 48 Lib Dem Lords voted against an EU Referendum. Demand the say you deserve http://t.co/bmtExL9YkU ht…
As Labour and the Lib Dems have killed the Wharton Bill, the one way to guarantee a referendum is to vote Conservative at the Gen Election.
I've been meeting with President Hollande - discussing the many areas where the UK & France can and do work together. http://t.co/MXemsVwoga
My warmest wishes to everyone celebrating Chinese New Year. Xin Nian Kuai Le!
We can't let Labour's secret borrowing plans put the financial security of families at risk: http://t.co/ZWesqdkaft http://t.co/wcyyYcPFu7
RT @Conservatives: RT this to let friends know that #SameOldLabour would wreck the economy again with more spending, borrowing and taxes ht…
After encouraging economic news, meaning more jobs and security for people, it's clear the biggest risk to recovery is Labour. #LabourRisk.
Great talking to Steve Wright and Tim Smith - my interview with them is on this afternoon @BBCRadio2 http://t.co/b267hUCRxC
Thanks to everyone who helped our economy grow again last quarter. Together we'll secure a better future for Britain. http://t.co/VTqTSx46Mi
The #GDP figures are another sign our #LongTermEconomicPlan is working - more growth means more jobs, security and opportunities for people.

RT @BBCHughPym: Economic output ( GDP) in fourth quarter 2013 up 0.7 per cent
over year looks like fastest growth since 2007
Meeting Holocaust survivors at No10-I told them I've set up a commission to ensure we continue to remember #HMD2014 http://t.co/22T28Ql9Fm
Today we come together to remember the darkest hour in our history: The Holocaust. #HMD2014 @HolocaustUK http://t.co/ssedYfoeIa
We are on the side of Britain's small businesses - share this to show that you are too. http://t.co/RygylPYULn
With @MaryMacleodMP at Lot's Ait Boatyard, a Brentford business expanding & creating more jobs. #LongTermEconomicPlan http://t.co/DfiIbbQlWe
With @karren_brady, telling small businesses how we're slashing red tape to help them thrive and create more jobs. http://t.co/xlmiXUNmEe
I'm on @BBCr4today at 810 - talking to @EvanHD about the economy and how we're helping small business fight red tape. #LongTermEconomicPlan.
7 things that happened this week that show our #LongTermEconomicPlan is helping hardworking people: http://t.co/qAMQ4VVPRR
My message to @wef: our #LongTermEconomicPlan will bring overseas jobs back to Britain, giving families more security http://t.co/CCtpIGHFgn
No10 was one of @VentAxia's first customers - but not a very profitable one, as they still haven't cashed the cheque! http://t.co/JKH65fHCfD
Today I visited @VentAxia, a UK company bringing jobs back from China. Proof we're starting to win in the #GlobalRace http://t.co/1PIkOhZe26
RT @Conservatives: People want to know they are safe on their streets and in their homes - and our plan to make sure they are is working ht…
I also told @tombradby about why we're working to a #LongTermEconomicPlan and who it's for - more on @itvnews at 6.30 http://t.co/DOY06ttGqm
Talking to @Peston about how our #LongTermEconomicPlan is bringing security & opportunity. See it on @BBCNews at 6pm. http://t.co/SA7GO2aSDS
Good to see a big drop in the number of pupils at failing schools. Improving standards is a key part of our #LongTermEconomicPlan.
Congratulations to the police. Independent stats show #CrimeIsFalling again, bringing security to people. It's down over 10% under this govt
More people in work, taking home a pay packet and providing for their families. Our #LongTermEconomicPlan is working. http://t.co/RXoO03euVq
You can see a short film on how our #LongTermEconomicPlan is helping people get on in life here: https://t.co/3atjagpxDD
The biggest quarterly increase in employment on record. More jobs means more security, peace of mind and opportunity for the British people.
Well done to @RBWM - a Conservative council cutting council tax for the fifth year in a row, so people keep more of their hard-earned money.
An encouraging sign of more jobs and security #ForHardworkingPeople: the #IMF confirms upgrading our growth forecast. #LongTermEconomicPlan
The expected IMF upgrade of our growth forecast is another sign our #LongTermEconomicPlan is providing jobs & security #ForHardworkingPeople
Do you agree with my decision to protect the Triple Lock on pensions after 2015 to increase security in retirement? http://t.co/DSO9nkgkPS
Called Petr Fiala tonight to congratulate him on his election as leader of the Czech ODS party - our partners in the European Parliament.
Chris Chataway was one of a kind. We have lost a Great Briton, a true Conservative and a man of many talents.
My thoughts are with Lord McAlpine's family - he was a dedicated supporter of Margaret Thatcher and the Conservative party.
In Norwich with @ChloeSmithMP to discuss our plans to speed up East of England rail services. #LongTermEconomicPlan http://t.co/Uf51XY91MQ
Discussed the £1.9bn we're investing in East of England roads with @peter_aldous and local businesses #LongTermPlan http://t.co/rBnNFUC5RN
Many congratulations to Zara and Mike Tindall on the birth of their baby girl #RoyalBaby
Great to join @trussliz this morning to see the £105m project to dual the A11 near Thetford #LongTermEconomicPlan http://t.co/zRSQvNuglM
Why I believe it is right to increase the minimum wage: https://t.co/BG7XxF69eP
RT @George_Osborne: Because our long term economic plan is working Britain can afford a real rise in the minimum wage to secure a recovery …
On time and on budget, the £14.8bn London Crossrail project is more proof our #LongTermEconomicPlan is working http://t.co/Ew7BqFxt2k
What happened in #Amritsar 30 years ago must never be forgotten. I understand concerns & the inquiry into any UK link will get to the truth.
It's welcome news that inflation is down & on target. As the economy grows & jobs are created this means more security #forhardworkingpeople
Hearing about the huge potential for jobs & growth from shale at an IGas site on the Lincs/Notts border #LongTermPlan http://t.co/w2LIj4YyGy
Allowing councils to keep 100% of business rates from fracking is part of our #LongTermEconomicPlan, creating tens of thousands of jobs.
Congratulations to everyone involved with the British film "12 Years a Slave" -which did so well at the #GoldenGlobes.
Great news for Britain and for jobs as Jaguar Land Rover announce they sold 425,000 vehicles last year - 19% more than in 2012 #LongTermPlan
Seeing impact of flooding here in my constituency. A big thank you to Oxfordshire Fire & Rescue, WODC and @EnvAgency. http://t.co/6EeX4csNeU
Today the EU Referendum Bill moves to the House of Lords. Join my call for an in-out referendum by the end of 2017 at http://t.co/F43p1JnHIP
We're cutting income tax to put more money in your pocket - part of our long-term plan. See how much you've saved: http://t.co/q30KB5vpvG
As an #AVFC fan, I've always admired what Thomas Hitzlsperger did on the pitch - but I admire him even more today. A brave & important move.
My thoughts are with the family of Paul Goggins-who have been left heartbroken by his death. He was liked and respected by MPs on all sides.
Simon Hoggart was one of the pioneers of the art of sketchwriting and an extraordinarily witty man. My condolences to his family and friends
.@George_Osborne is right - sticking to our long-term economic plan really matters for all our futures. Here's why: http://t.co/Y6wjP5MvdF
I'm on my way to The Marr Show where I'll talk about protecting pensioners and the latest phase of my long term economic plan. BBC1 9am.
More on my basic state pension pledge on the Andrew Marr Show on BBC1 at 9am tomorrow.
I pledge to keep the "triple lock" on the basic state pension after 2015. It'll rise in line with wages, prices or 2.5%, whichever's higher.
Great work by emergency services & @EnvAgency helping people flooded. 200000 properties have been protected by flood defences in last 36hrs.
I've been talking to @IsabelOakeshott from @thesundaytimes. You can read my interview with her in tomorrow's paper. http://t.co/laiJ66JBFx
With more severe weather, it's important people in threatened areas keep up to date through local media, @metoffice and @EnvAgency.
I'm ensuring that all is being done to help with the floods. There'll be a COBRA meeting shortly and regular updates from @EnvAgency.
I also spoke to Sally Taylor @BBCSouthNews - that interview goes out at 6.30 pm http://t.co/ObXY2leNzL
Talking to Fred and Sangeeta @itvmeridian about #HelpToBuy, rail fares and flooding. The interview goes out at 6pm. http://t.co/pDbcURgERW
Stunning views in Southampton from a major new development being boosted by #HelpToBuy mortgages http://t.co/3tUdaFEeJg
Sharon & Maisie show me their lovely new home - just one of the families helped onto the housing ladder by #HelpToBuy http://t.co/7yqb8NKdci
I'm heading to Southampton to meet some of the people benefiting from  £1bn in mortgages after just 3 months of the #HelpToBuy scheme.
RT @HBaldwinMP: 10 Resolutions To Help You Succeed In 2014 http://t.co/imREYuEvoO via @buzzfeeders
In 2014 we must carry on working through our long-term plan to secure Britain's future. Watch my New Year's message: https://t.co/6Ji7dhYbnS

2014 is the year when the whole country can rise - my New Year's message in @thetimes: 
https://t.co/nnbnC0JYiq
Happy New Year!
